channel.title: How can I take all my rares from the people?
channel.description: Ok, so random noobs have like 99k of a lot of rares... I only want to give them out. So far, there is know way I know of where they can get them. Now, it will take too long to search through 7k+ accounts... Is there something I can do to remove them? Similar to the Economy Booster? But just not delete all their items?

where can i download this?

@rune-pure wrote:

So you want to delete some of there items…

Open up the char file…

Search for there names (btw instead of scrolling through 7k accs… there is a search button… well on my comp)

Find the items you want to delete…aka id… and remove them

item.source: How can I take all my rares from the people?

item.title: How can I take all my rares from the people?
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:10, topic:251403”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=331828.msg2590680#msg2590680 date=1229742681]

Here.

import java.io.*;

public class DeleteRares
{
	public static void main(String args[])
	{
		/**
		 * Put the item ids in this array.
		 * Don't put notes, though.
		 */
		int[] rares = {1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048, 1050};
		File charFolder;
		BufferedWriter bw;
		BufferedReader br;
		BufferedWriter tmpwr;
		BufferedReader tmpr;
		boolean overwrite = false;
		String read;
		String dir = "characters/";
		double done = 0;
		int percent = 0;
		int percentRounded = 0;

		charFolder = new File(dir);

		if(!charFolder.exists())
		{
			System.out.println("The directory "+dir+" was not found.");
			return;
		}
		else
		if(charFolder.list().length == 0)
		{
			System.out.println("The specified directory is empty.");
			return;
		}
		String file[] = charFolder.list();
		for(String s : file)
		{
			try
			{
				boolean isAdmin = false;
				File charFile = new File(dir+s);
				File tmpFile = new File(dir+s+".tmp");
				tmpFile.createNewFile();
				br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(charFile));
				tmpwr = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(tmpFile, true));

				while((read = br.readLine()) != null)
				{
					if(read.contains("character-rights"))
					{
						if(read.charAt(read.length() - 1) > '1')
						{
							System.out.println("Bank saved for admin "+s.substring(0, s.indexOf(".")));
							isAdmin = true;
						}
					}

					if(read.equals("[ITEMS]"))
					{
						if(!isAdmin)
						{
							overwrite = true;
						}
					}

					if(read.equals("[FRIENDS]"))
						overwrite = false;

					if(!overwrite)
					{
						tmpwr.write(read);
						tmpwr.newLine();
					}
					else if(!isAdmin)
					{
						boolean found = false;
						for(int i : rares)
						{
							if(read.contains("\t" + i + "\t") || read.contains("\t" + (i + 1) + "\t"))
							{
								found = true;
							}
						}
						if(!found)
						{
							tmpwr.write(read);
							tmpwr.newLine();
						}
					}
				}
				tmpwr.flush();
				tmpwr.close();
				br.close();

				charFile.delete();

				bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(charFile, true));
				tmpr = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(tmpFile));

				while((read = tmpr.readLine()) != null)
				{
					bw.write(read);
					bw.newLine();
				}

				bw.flush();
				bw.close();
				tmpr.close();
				tmpFile.delete();

				done++;

				if((percent = (int)(done / file.length * 100)) % 5 < 5 && percent - percent % 5 != percentRounded)
					System.out.println((percentRounded = (int)(percent - percent % 5))+"%");
			}
			catch(IOException Ioe)
			{
				Ioe.printStackTrace();
			}
		}
		System.out.println("Finished!");
	}
}

Edit: It now deletes notes of the selected items, but make sure you don’t put noted ids in the array.

Thank you so much. Rep++ for you.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 19, 2008, 04:46:42 pm[/size][hr]Why can’t I put noted ones in the Array?

It automatically deletes notes already, but the way it’s set up if you put a note in the array it will delete an item that you may not want to delete.
For example, if you put the noted red partyhat id in (1039) then it will delete the next id (1040) also, which is a yellow partyhat.
I might take that feature out, do you think I should?

How do you initialize that class?

Running the server?

Lol, I know - Stupid question.

You run a class with java.exe.
You compile a class into bytecode with javac.
[/quote]

You can only run a class if it has a main method. Otherwise you’ll get

[quote]
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: main
[/quote][/quote]
Pretty much common sense.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I take all my rares from the people?

item.title: How can I take all my rares from the people?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:10, topic:251403”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=331828.msg2590680#msg2590680 date=1229742681]

Here.

import java.io.*;

public class DeleteRares
{
	public static void main(String args[])
	{
		/**
		 * Put the item ids in this array.
		 * Don't put notes, though.
		 */
		int[] rares = {1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048, 1050};
		File charFolder;
		BufferedWriter bw;
		BufferedReader br;
		BufferedWriter tmpwr;
		BufferedReader tmpr;
		boolean overwrite = false;
		String read;
		String dir = "characters/";
		double done = 0;
		int percent = 0;
		int percentRounded = 0;

		charFolder = new File(dir);

		if(!charFolder.exists())
		{
			System.out.println("The directory "+dir+" was not found.");
			return;
		}
		else
		if(charFolder.list().length == 0)
		{
			System.out.println("The specified directory is empty.");
			return;
		}
		String file[] = charFolder.list();
		for(String s : file)
		{
			try
			{
				boolean isAdmin = false;
				File charFile = new File(dir+s);
				File tmpFile = new File(dir+s+".tmp");
				tmpFile.createNewFile();
				br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(charFile));
				tmpwr = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(tmpFile, true));

				while((read = br.readLine()) != null)
				{
					if(read.contains("character-rights"))
					{
						if(read.charAt(read.length() - 1) > '1')
						{
							System.out.println("Bank saved for admin "+s.substring(0, s.indexOf(".")));
							isAdmin = true;
						}
					}

					if(read.equals("[ITEMS]"))
					{
						if(!isAdmin)
						{
							overwrite = true;
						}
					}

					if(read.equals("[FRIENDS]"))
						overwrite = false;

					if(!overwrite)
					{
						tmpwr.write(read);
						tmpwr.newLine();
					}
					else if(!isAdmin)
					{
						boolean found = false;
						for(int i : rares)
						{
							if(read.contains("\t" + i + "\t") || read.contains("\t" + (i + 1) + "\t"))
							{
								found = true;
							}
						}
						if(!found)
						{
							tmpwr.write(read);
							tmpwr.newLine();
						}
					}
				}
				tmpwr.flush();
				tmpwr.close();
				br.close();

				charFile.delete();

				bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(charFile, true));
				tmpr = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(tmpFile));

				while((read = tmpr.readLine()) != null)
				{
					bw.write(read);
					bw.newLine();
				}

				bw.flush();
				bw.close();
				tmpr.close();
				tmpFile.delete();

				done++;

				if((percent = (int)(done / file.length * 100)) % 5 < 5 && percent - percent % 5 != percentRounded)
					System.out.println((percentRounded = (int)(percent - percent % 5))+"%");
			}
			catch(IOException Ioe)
			{
				Ioe.printStackTrace();
			}
		}
		System.out.println("Finished!");
	}
}

Edit: It now deletes notes of the selected items, but make sure you don’t put noted ids in the array.

Thank you so much. Rep++ for you.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 19, 2008, 04:46:42 pm[/size][hr]Why can’t I put noted ones in the Array?

It automatically deletes notes already, but the way it’s set up if you put a note in the array it will delete an item that you may not want to delete.
For example, if you put the noted red partyhat id in (1039) then it will delete the next id (1040) also, which is a yellow partyhat.
I might take that feature out, do you think I should?

How do you initialize that class?

Running the server?

Lol, I know - Stupid question.

You run a class with java.exe.
You compile a class into bytecode with javac.
[/quote]

You can only run a class if it has a main method. Otherwise you’ll get

[quote]
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: main
[/quote][/quote]
Yeah, I guess I should have mentioned that.

import java.io.*;

public class DeleteRares
{
	public static void main(String args[])
	{
		/**
		 * Put the item ids in this array.
		 * Don't put notes, though.
		 */
		int[] rares = {1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048, 1050};
		File charFolder;

			}
		}
		System.out.println("Finished!");
	}
}

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:2, topic:251403”]Here.

import java.io.*;

public class DeleteRares
{
	public static void main(String args[])
	{
		/**
		 * Put the item ids in this array.
		 * Don't put notes, though.
		 */
		int[] rares = {1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048, 1050};
		File charFolder;
		BufferedWriter bw;
		BufferedReader br;
		BufferedWriter tmpwr;
		BufferedReader tmpr;

		String read;

		if(!charFolder.exists())
		{
			System.out.println("The directory "+dir+" was not found.");
			return;
		}
		else
		if(charFolder.list().length == 0)
		{
			System.out.println("The specified directory is empty.");
			return;
		}
		String file[] = charFolder.list();
		for(String s : file)
		{
			try
			{
				boolean isAdmin = false;
				File charFile = new File(dir+s);
				File tmpFile = new File(dir+s+".tmp");
				tmpFile.createNewFile();
				br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(charFile));
				tmpwr = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(tmpFile, true));

				while((read = br.readLine()) != null)
				{
					if(read.contains("character-rights"))
					{
						if(read.charAt(read.length() - 1) > '1')
						{
							System.out.println("Bank saved for admin "+s.substring(0, s.indexOf(".")));
							isAdmin = true;
						}
					}

					if(read.equals("[ITEMS]"))
					{
						if(!isAdmin)
						{
							overwrite = true;
						}
					}

					if(read.equals("[FRIENDS]"))
						overwrite = false;

					if(!overwrite)
					{
						tmpwr.write(read);
						tmpwr.newLine();
					}
					else if(!isAdmin)
					{
						boolean found = false;
						for(int i : rares)
						{
							if(read.contains("\t" + i + "\t") || read.contains("\t" + (i + 1) + "\t"))
							{
								found = true;
							}
						}
						if(!found)
						{
							tmpwr.write(read);
							tmpwr.newLine();
						}
					}
				}
				tmpwr.flush();
				tmpwr.close();
				br.close();

				charFile.delete();

				bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(charFile, true));
				tmpr = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(tmpFile));

				while((read = tmpr.readLine()) != null)
				{
					bw.write(read);
					bw.newLine();
				}

				bw.flush();
				bw.close();
				tmpr.close();
				tmpFile.delete();

				done++;

				if((percent = (int)(done / file.length * 100)) % 5 < 5 && percent - percent % 5 != percentRounded)
					System.out.println((percentRounded = (int)(percent - percent % 5))+"%");
			}
			catch(IOException Ioe)
			{
				Ioe.printStackTrace();
			}
		}
		System.out.println("Finished!");
	}
}

Edit: It now deletes notes of the selected items, but make sure you don’t put noted ids in the array.[/quote]
Thank you so much. Rep++ for you.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 19, 2008, 04:46:42 pm[/size][hr]Why can’t I put noted ones in the Array?

Read full topic

item.title: How can I take all my rares from the people?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Here.

import java.io.*;

public class DeleteRares
{
	public static void main(String args[])
	{
		/**
		 * Put the item ids in this array.
		 * Don't put notes, though.
		 */
		int[] rares = {1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048, 1050};
		File charFolder;
		BufferedWriter bw;
		BufferedReader br;
		BufferedWriter tmpwr;
		BufferedReader tmpr;
		boolean overwrite = false;
		String read;
		String dir = "characters/";
		double done = 0;
		int percent = 0;
		int percentRounded = 0;

		charFolder = new File(dir);

		if(!charFolder.exists())
		{
			System.out.println("The directory "+dir+" was not found.");
			return;
		}
		else
		if(charFolder.list().length == 0)
		{
			System.out.println("The specified directory is empty.");
			return;
		}
		String file[] = charFolder.list();
		for(String s : file)
		{
			try
			{
				boolean isAdmin = false;
				File charFile = new File(dir+s);
				File tmpFile = new File(dir+s+".tmp");
				tmpFile.createNewFile();
				br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(charFile));
				tmpwr = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(tmpFile, true));

				while((read = br.readLine()) != null)
				{
					if(read.contains("character-rights"))
					{
						if(read.charAt(read.length() - 1) > '1')
						{
							System.out.println("Bank saved for admin "+s.substring(0, s.indexOf(".")));
							isAdmin = true;
						}
					}

					if(read.equals("[ITEMS]"))
					{
						if(!isAdmin)
						{
							overwrite = true;
						}
					}

					if(read.equals("[FRIENDS]"))
						overwrite = false;

					if(!overwrite)
					{
						tmpwr.write(read);
						tmpwr.newLine();
					}
					else if(!isAdmin)
					{
						boolean found = false;
						for(int i : rares)
						{
							if(read.contains("\t" + i + "\t") || read.contains("\t" + (i + 1) + "\t"))
							{
								found = true;
							}
						}
						if(!found)
						{
							tmpwr.write(read);
							tmpwr.newLine();
						}
					}
				}
				tmpwr.flush();
				tmpwr.close();
				br.close();

				charFile.delete();

				bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(charFile, true));
				tmpr = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(tmpFile));

				while((read = tmpr.readLine()) != null)
				{
					bw.write(read);
					bw.newLine();
				}

				bw.flush();
				bw.close();
				tmpr.close();
				tmpFile.delete();

				done++;

				if((percent = (int)(done / file.length * 100)) % 5 < 5 && percent - percent % 5 != percentRounded)
					System.out.println((percentRounded = (int)(percent - percent % 5))+"%");
			}
			catch(IOException Ioe)
			{
				Ioe.printStackTrace();
			}
		}
		System.out.println("Finished!");
	}
}

Edit: It now deletes notes of the selected items, but make sure you don’t put noted ids in the array.

Now, it will take too long to search through 7k+ accounts… Is there something I can do to remove them? Similar to the Economy Booster? But just not delete all their items?
